title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as the Short Title. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of "Institute" as established under the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Arts Development Act. It also defines "tribally controlled community colleges" as per the Tribal College Assistance Act of 1978. The Tribal College Assistance Act of 1978 defines tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions. The term "tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions" is given meaning by the Tribal College Assistance Act of 1990. Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions have SEC. 3 land grant status. Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions, such as the Institute, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, and Haskell Indian Junior College, are considered land-grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanical arts according to the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. The applicability of related provisions of any Act of Congress relating to the operation or assistance to a land-grant college in the United States, Puerto Rico, or the District of Columbia is also mentioned. The Act of July 2, 1862 applies to land-grant colleges in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, and other territories. Authorization of appropriations is also mentioned for the endowment and maintenance of colleges benefiting agriculture and mechanical arts. Authorized appropriations of $10,000,000 for tribal colleges and institutions for the endowment and maintenance of colleges benefiting agriculture and the mechanical arts. Amounts appropriated under this section are considered grants to such colleges and institutions subject to applicable provisions of the Act. The Act titled "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993" defines the term "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993". The term "1994 Institutions" in the Act refers to a list of colleges including Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, and others. The Act refers to a list of colleges known as "1994 Institutions," which includes Navajo Community College, United Tribes Technical College, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, Crownpoint Institute of Technology, Haskell Indian Junior College, Leech Lake Tribal College, and College of the Menominee Nation. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts. Provisions of Acts of Congress related to land-grant colleges apply to 1994 Institutions, with exceptions for agricultural research funding under specific Acts. The Act authorizes $23,000,000 to be appropriated to 1994 Institutions in place of extending provisions related to donations of public land. Amounts granted are subject to provisions applicable to proceeds from land sales. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include funding for 1994 Institutions. Section 3 of the Act of May 8, 1914 is also amended. Section 3 of the Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 allocated annually for specified purposes. The funds will be distributed through a competitive application process to State institutions in cooperation with 1994 Institutions. The Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions without a matching requirement for funds under subsection (b)(3). SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and facilities for research in agriculture and sciences through matching grants. $1,700,000 is authorized for grants for fiscal years 1995 through 1999. For fiscal years 1995 through 1999, $1,700,000 is authorized for grants to 1994 Institutions for research facilities in agriculture and sciences. Amend the title to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
